H0.text: What plant was traditionally cultivated in Europe for its unique blue dye. Indigo Plant

H1.text: What plant was traditionally cultivated in Europe for its unique blue dye. Flax

H2.text: What plant was traditionally cultivated in Europe for its unique blue dye. Cornflower

H3.text: What plant was traditionally cultivated in Europe for its unique blue dye. Woad

A4.text: Woad was an important source of blue dye and was cultivated throughout Europe, especially in Western and Southern Europe.

A5.text: Woad was eventually replaced by the more colourfast Indigofera tinctoria
